page.title: 04LITTLEPORT PRIMARY SCHOOL
page.content: 377 children attend the school;their ages vary from 5 to 11. There are 13 teachers. Before the industrial action 190 children had{school meals,}100 had sandwiches and 87 went home. The meals are made by the cook, on the site. Children do not have to wear{uniform. The present site of the school will no longer be used as a school in 2 years time because it will be moving to the village college site. The school was built in 1846. By 1870, there were 537 children. Being a rural area, there were split summer holidays and leaving at 12 if you passed a{"Labour Exam".}Each hamlet had its own school and pupils had to walk every day. The last one to close will be Little Ouse this year. Its pupils will be bussed here. In 1939, three{London}schools were evacuated here.
